medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms related to a history of trauma, including anxiety, panic attacks, and obsessive-compulsive traits.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms first presented in 1975 with complaints of anxiety, which included somatic symptoms, phobias, and obsessive concerns. After experiencing multiple traumatic events, including being held hostage and raped, symptoms worsened markedly. Symptoms of panic and extensive agoraphobic avoidance emerged in 1984, exacerbated by her living situation. The PTSD diagnosis was made 22 years later, indicating that symptoms had worsened over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Borderline diabetes, chronic back, bladder, and kidney problems. History of hospitalization for urinary tract infections.
medical_history.family_history: Father was an alcoholic. Family issues included separation of parents, and a favorite relative died from complications of an abortion. No other specific hereditary conditions were mentioned.
medical_history.social_history: Multiple long-standing financial and educational difficulties. Intermittent employment in bars and fast-food restaurants, with significant concerns regarding housing and parenting difficulties. Ms. A faced challenges related to her children's behavioral issues and had limited educational background, dropping out of high school.
